Posts.Content: No mention of radiation yet by my oncologist. Thanks for your response.Actually my testosterone level was at 44 when I got that last psa score.
Posts.Title: PSA 268 / Gleason 8 / Bone Mets

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by GeorgeS I will do. Today (as I will once a week) I chatted up the RO who is very optimistic that long term recovery is not only possible but quite possible. He pulled up a few reports from PUBMED that had node positive folks (like me) in remission 5 and 10years out from the RT. (very healthy and respectable percentages to boot! (IE: Above 50%) He may insist that the "recipe" of RT+18mo's ADT be followed but I told him that was not an issue as long as I can have a END DATE for the ADT! I was diagnosed last month with a psa of 268 Gleason 8 with bone mets and one lymph node effected. I was immediately put on casodex then a week later lupron. Then 2weeks after that my oncologist scheduled me for 6 rounds of docetaxel. The day of my first round of chemo I got the test results of my baseline psa and it had dropped down to 48 from 268 in a matter of just 2 weeks of lupron and casodex therapy only. I'm hoping this is a sign that lupron will work very well for me going forward. I have read that lupron/docetaxel treatment right at diagnosis is having very good long term results for men with advanced PC that hasn't spread to any organs.
Posts.Title: PSA 268 / Gleason 8 / Bone Mets

Posts.Content: Hi gentlemen, I have an update from my most recent psa test from a couple weeks ago..It dropped down to 2.77 from 3.75. I also will be taking my psa test every 2 or 3 months from now on to eliminate some of the stress...
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed June 2018 with advanced prostate cancer after getting my first PSA test for a routine physical. 47 yrs old. At time of diagnosis. PSA after checkup- 200.1 PSA immediately after DRE 268. Biopsy determined spread to bones and a lymph node. Gleason 8 Put on Cassodex immediately after Biopsy result ( 1 month) Started lupron injections a week after Cassodex. ( injection every 4 months) Started Chemo (Docetaxel) at the end of July 2018 ( six cycles) Psa numbers 200.1 june 2018 268 june 2018 this psa test was taken about 1/2 hour after my DRE ! 48.18 July 2018 started docetaxel 1.96 aug 2018 4.94 sept 2018 Docetaxel caused this maybe? 5.66 sept 2018 4.37 oct 2018 4.36 nov 2018 put on Zometa 1 week after last cycle of chemo 3.60 Dec 2018 followup ct and bone scan showed a lot of reduction in mets. 3.75 jan 2019

Posts.Title: Back for a six month update...PSA is doing strange things

Posts.Content: Thank you Michael, I'm with Kaiser on the east coast, northern VA. When it dropped from 4.3 to 3.6 right before Xmas I was riding high then this test brought me crashing back down. I'm trying to remain positive until the next test and speaking to you guys is really helping.I went through this once already in September.. I'm kind of embarrassed being on here worrying about this slight rise when there are a lot of other people on here facing far greater problems.

Posts.Title: Back for a six month update...PSA is doing strange things

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, six months into this I'm now a little worried but maybe I shouldn't be. Lupron moved my psa down from around the mid 200s to about 50 pretty quickly .My oncologist started me on docetaxel at this point. Here are my psa scores along the way. 48 at start of docetaxel psa test every 3 weeks 48 1.9 4.9 5.6 4.3 4.3 end docetaxel start zometa psa test every 4 wks 3.61 3.75 What's bothering me is my most recent PSA test. The jump in psa in the beginning I think was because of the docetaxel but I'm a little worried about the slight rise now.What do you guys think about this? Am I being paranoid? My stats- psa 268 at diagnosis Gleason 8 bone mets and a couple lymph nodes affected.lupron every 4 months, 6 cycles docetaxel at beginning of treatment a Zometa after I finished docetaxel. I had another bone and ct scan a couple weeks ago that showed a lot of improvement. My last psa test was just taken on Monday Jan 7th. 2019. Thank you all ,these monthly psa test are really getting to me...
Posts.Title: Back for a six month update...PSA is doing strange things

Posts.Content: Thanks for your response, having a psa test every month really gets to me especially when something unexpected happens. I have a wonderful very supportive wife but sometimes I feel very alone going through this regardless, That's one of the reasons I'm reaching out to this forum and will be for now on..Thank you.

Posts.Title: Back for a six month update...PSA is doing strange things

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Michael F Welcome back Shanis! You are experiencing what we have dubbed "The Dreaded PSA Anxiety!" You certainly are not alone! So please visit more often and feel free to vent. If willing, please share where you are being treated. There may be other Forum Brothers (FBs) who have been treated in the same system. Re PSA: Nearly all of us have experienced some degree of "PSA Bounce." Thus and uptick of approx 4% may not be significant. Your Oncologist knows best! Some suggested questions/issues to discuss with your Oncologist are: - What PSA Nadir would be considered optimal? - What are the next treatment options if/when the PSA begins to rise? Continue to ask questions and seek correct answers. And keep us updated! Maintain healthy lifestyles via good diet, lots of exercise and sleep. We're with you every step of this journey! May 2019 be a Great Year!!! MF - Thank you Djin, you guys on this forum are amazing.
